pullRequest.body:
In earlier PRs it was shown that the LÃ©vy-Prokhorov distance pseudometrizes the convergence in distribution (i.e. weak convergence of probability measures) on separable pseudometric spaces. This PR strengthens the conclusion: the LP distance on probability measures on Borel spaces is a metric (not just a pseudometric), and therefore in separable Borel spaces, convergence in distribution is metrizable (not just pseudometrizable).

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11212287218/job/31162977019)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11212287218/job/31162976558)
I may have more to say after some of this has been addressed.

Thanks!
bors r+
I may have more to say after some of this has been addressed.
Looks good to me. Please apply the suggestion of Jason and let's wait a bit for Jireh, but otherwise the PR seems good to go.

Thanks!
bors r+

If you want this, and the other three `def`s below to be coercions, then you need to do two things:

1. Define appropriate `Coe` instances for each. (this allows Lean to look for the coercion during elaboration, so that you don't have to manually insert it)
2. add the `@[coe]` attribute, which allows Lean to display a `â` in the infoview and makes `norm_cast` aware that this is a coercion for its purposes.

However, that being said, I tend to think that you don't want *any* of these. Instead, it seems like you want a "parameterized type synonym", much like we have for `WithLp` or `Lex`. So I think you just want a *single* `def`, and it should be an `Equiv`, not a plain function. That is:
```lean
-- maybe you could make `Î±` implicit?
def LevyProkhorov.equiv (Î± : Type*) : LevyProkhorov Î± â Î± where
  ...
```
Thanks! I did this and it looks cleaner indeed --- maybe a little less descriptive as naming, but much better that the "coercion" is not special-cased to both cases of interest.
I noticed that I should still update naming of the lemmas to refer to this equiv, so I marked as "awaiting author" again until then...

```suggestion
  show Î¼.toProbabilityMeasure = Î½.toProbabilityMeasure
```
Then you can unindent and remove the `exact same` at the end.

Or better yet, you can use my `equiv` suggestion above and just make this line:
```suggestion
  apply LevyProkhorov.equiv.injective
```
and remove the defeq abuse in its entirety.

```suggestion
  Â· exact measure_le_measure_closure_of_levyProkhorovEDist_eq_zero
      hLP s_closed.measurableSet hÎ½s |>.trans <|
      le_of_eq (congr_arg _ s_closed.closure_eq)
  Â· exact measure_le_measure_closure_of_levyProkhorovEDist_eq_zero
      (levyProkhorovEDist_comm Î¼ Î½ â¸ hLP) s_closed.measurableSet hÎ¼s |>.trans <|
      le_of_eq (congr_arg _ s_closed.closure_eq)
```

```suggestion
def LevyProkhorov.equiv (Î± : Type*) : LevyProkhorov Î± â Î± := Equiv.refl _
```
I think this is better
The `of_X_of_Y` in the name should be in the same order as `X` and `Y` in the hypotheses. So with this hypothesis order it should be `measure_eq_measure_of_levyProkhorovEDist_eq_zero_of_isClosed`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: in separable Borel spaces, convergence in distribution is metrizable (not just pseudometrizable)
